com.lambda.map
Class Map

java.lang.Object
  com.lambda.map.Map

public class Map
extends java.lang.Object

The 'Map' is a storage for 'Tiles'. The rendering of the 'Map' can be optimized by setting a 'clipping range', which will determine which 'Tiles' to render.

Author:
alex

Constructor Summary
Map(int width, int height)
          Creates a new 'Map' with a certain amount of 'Tiles' in x- and in y-direction.

Constructor Detail

Map

public Map(int width,
           int height)
Creates a new 'Map' with a certain amount of 'Tiles' in x- and in y-direction.

Parameters:
width - The number of 'Tiles' in the x-direction.
height - The number of 'Tiles' in the y-direction.
Method Detail

getTile

public Tile getTile(int x,
                    int y)
Gives back the instance of a certain 'Tile' in the 'Map' at the location (x / y). If the coordinates are negative, or do not exist in the 'Map' 'null' will be returned.

Parameters:
x - The x-coordinate of the 'Tile' in the 'Map'.
y - The y-coordinate of the 'Tile' in the 'Map'.
Returns:
The 'Tile' at (x / y) or 'null' in case of an error.

render

public void render(float xOffset,
                   float yOffset)
Renders all 'Tiles' of the 'Map' in the order they are stored in the 'Map'. If a clipping area has been set, every 'Tile' outside of it, will not be rendered. Additionally an offset for the rendering can be specified.

Parameters:
xOffset - The offset in x-direction for the rendering.
yOffset - The offset in y-direction for the rendering.

update

public void update(double delta)
Updates every 'Tile' in the 'Map'.

Parameters:
delta - The difference in time between the processing of two frames.

setTile

public void setTile(Tile tile,
                    int x,
                    int y)
Sets the 'Tile' in the 'Map' at the location (x / y) to the 'Tile' 'tile'. If 'tile' is 'null', nothing will happen.

Parameters:
tile - The 'Tile' to set in the 'Map' at the location (x / y).
x - The x-coordinate of the 'Tile' in the 'Map'.
y - The y-coordinate of the 'Tile' in the 'Map'.

getWidth

public int getWidth()
Gives back the width of the 'Map'.

Returns:
The amount of 'Tiles' in x-direction.

getHeight

public int getHeight()
Gives back the height of the 'Map'.

Returns:
The amount of 'Tiles' in y-direction.

getClippingArea

public java.awt.Rectangle getClippingArea()
Gives back the 'Rectangle' that represents the clipping area.

Returns:
The area the clipping is active for.

setClippingArea

public void setClippingArea(java.awt.Rectangle clippingArea)
Sets the area the clipping work in to 'clippingArea'. This only works, if the 'Rectangle' 'clippingArea' is not 'null'.

Parameters:
clippingArea - The area the clipping will be active for.
